snippet: Economists see a number of sources of underlying strength, but some envision slower growth in 2013 even if Washington avoids a stalemate in the fiscal talks.
abstract: Economists see number of sources of underlying strength in the economy, but say trend will not gain traction unless political leaders find way to avoid broad tax increases and spending cuts now being debated; optimistic figures show growth could be as strong as 3 percent in 2013 if confidence is not undermined by austerity measures.
lead_paragraph: Economists see a number of sources of underlying strength, but some envision slower growth in 2013 even if Washington avoids a stalemate in the fiscal talks.

headline.seo: Fiscal Cliff Casts Big Shadow on Sunnier 2013 Economic Forecasts
headline.main: Forecast Is Sunnier, but Washington Casts a Big Shadow
headline.print_headline: Economic Forecast Is Sunnier, but Washington Casts a Big Shadow
